## Metabolism as You Age: A Comprehensive FAQ

As we age, our metabolism naturally slows down. This can lead to weight gain, fatigue, and other health issues. However, there are steps you can take to boost your metabolism and improve your overall health. In this FAQ, we'll answer some of the most common questions about metabolism as you age.

### Q: What is metabolism?

A: Metabolism is the process by which your body converts the food you eat into energy. This energy is used to power your body's functions, such as breathing, digestion, and physical activity.

### Q: Why does metabolism slow down as we age?

A: There are several reasons why metabolism slows down as we age. One reason is that we lose muscle mass as we get older, and muscle tissue burns more calories than fat tissue. Another reason is that our body's hormone levels change as we age, which can affect our metabolism.

### Q: How can I boost my metabolism as I age?

A: There are several ways to boost your metabolism as you age. One way is to engage in regular physical activity, particularly strength training. This can help you build and maintain muscle mass, which will increase your metabolism. Another way is to eat a healthy, balanced diet that includes plenty of protein. Protein can help you build and repair muscle tissue, which will also boost your metabolism.
